metadata.title: CVE-2017-16995 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
The check_alu_op function in kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveragingincorrect sign extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1016-aws - 4.4.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1').

linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
